item.title: Preface
item.description: Hello and welcome. Engineering Everything with eBPF is your friendly guide to eBPF on Linux. eBPF lets you run tiny programs inside the kernel so you can watch what the system is doing, filter network traffic, and even add safety checks—all without changing kernel source code. That sounds powerful, and it is. But it can also feel confusing the first time you see strange section names like SEC("xdp") or long helper calls.

item.title: Contribution Guidelines
item.description: We’re happy you want to make Engineering Everything with eBPF better. The steps below keep changes smooth and easy. Open an issue first Create a GitHub issue for typos, unclear text, new examples, or bugs in sample code. Show what you saw and what you expect instead. Screenshots or terminal output help a lot. Fork the repo and create a branch Fork, then name your branch clearly—­for example fix-ringbuf-example or add-cgroup-section.
